Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I learned a lot about when to use the different verb tenses in French. I also developed my speaking through the discussion of important works of French literature such as l'etranger by Albert Camus.
In this class my french only improved. My writing and reading skills especially have increased remarkably since when I finished French L2.
I feel more confident with my vocabulary and understanding of different verb forms such as the subjunctive and conditional, which were shaky before I took this class.
Intermediate understanding of French grammar and vocabulary.

I think the books and the movies are the strength of the class because they lead to good class discussion and they make the students utilize their French vocabulary in different ways. I think the main weakness of the course are the MMP's that follow the film Jules et Jim. They do help us learn but a lot of the things seem redundant.
There are no weaknesses, I think the balance of books and movies we read was adequate.
A focus on speaking in the classroom, I felt as though there was not much of a focus on speaking, writing or forming sentences.
I feel like the French speaking portion of the course should be emphasized a little more because I still feel that speaking and listening was a weakness for everybody.
Heavy workload that doesnt always feel valuable, class would be stronger if there was more time for students to practice speaking the language instead of just memorizing
I would recommend this class for another student and would also tell the student to keep in mind the heavy workload that goes along with this class.
I would, it is a good way to conclude the language requirement.
Yes! It was a very effective and engaging and ENJOYABLE French class and I highly enjoyed it.
